1552807915_1CBZY3cuYKeHZXEeHVxRFLmsCr3Um.body:
> [satoxyn1](#comment_11_1LGApmQZPN49nawg4HQQgf8ToVUPxGe2Zq): There's no "server side" (=php) code in ZeroNet, all user code is executed in browser and contain in .js files. The databases are user readable.

Right, so basically it's impossible to run a site like Reddit/Facebook/Twitter etc.

Because it would eventually run up into the Gigabytes/Terabytes and be unable to be seeded by the majority of peers?

Also how could Zeronet deal with vast numbers of users?

If changes are being published faster than you can update, that would also pose a huge problem?

(Say 100+ posts made per second)
